title: Manuel Carizza
text:
Manuel Nicolás Carizza (born 23 August 1984 in <a href="Rosario">Rosario</a>) is an <a href="Argentine">Argentine</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> footballer who usually plays as a lock. He currently plays for French <a href="Top%2014">Top 14</a> side . He started his career with Argentine club <a href="Jockey%20Club%20de%20Rosario%20%28rugby%29">Jockey Club de Rosario</a> until he joined French side in 2005. He spent seven years at Biarritz before joining for the 2012–13 season. In 2014, he signed for South African <a href="Super%20Rugby">Super Rugby</a> side the and also played for their affiliated domestic provincial side , but returned to Racing Métro (since rebranded as ) for the 2015–16 season.
He made his international debut for Argentina in December 2004 in a match against <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">South Africa</a>, which the Springboks won by 39 points to 7. He next played for the Pumas in April 2005, where he was called up to the starting line-up against <a href="Japan%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Japan</a>. He then played in the November Tests against the Springboks, <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> and <a href="Italy%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Italy</a>.
He was capped in June 2006 in one of the Tests against <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales</a> during the hosting of a two match series, which Argentina eventually won. He was capped against <a href="Chile%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Chile</a> and <a href="Uruguay%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Uruguay</a> in July, in the starting line-up for both games.
He signed for <a href="South%20Africa">South Africa</a>n <a href="Super%20Rugby">Super Rugby</a> side the for the <a href="2014%20Super%20Rugby%20season">2014 Super Rugby season</a>.
Honours.
 <a href="Racing%2092">Racing 92</a>
